category.title: The Joseph Smith Papers Television Documentary Series Season 1
category.subtitle: Videos: 52

item.title: Episode 0—Pilot—The Joseph Smith Papers: A Television Foreword
item.description: Introduces Joseph Smith, gives an overview of the Joseph Smith Papers Project, and provides perspectives from scholars on Joseph Smith’s significance and the importance of publishing his papers.

item.title: Episode 1—The Joseph Smith Papers
item.description: Describes in more depth the organization and significance of the Joseph Smith Papers Project. Managing editor Ronald K. Esplin discusses the different types of documents that will be included.

item.title: Episode 2—Joseph Smith’s New England Beginnings
item.description: An in-depth look at the family heritage that helped shape Joseph Smith, including profiles of his parents and grandparents.

item.title: Episode 3—Joseph Smith’s America
item.description: Explores the historical context into which Joseph Smith was born.

item.title: Episode 4—Joseph Smith’s Palmyra
item.description: Provides a window into the lives of the Smith family during their time in Palmyra, New York—the small town where Joseph Smith came of age.

item.title: Episode 5—The Setting of the First Vision
item.description: Sets the stage for Joseph Smith’s first vision of heavenly beings that would propel him into his life as the founder of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Episode 6—The First Vision
item.description: Explores the differing accounts of Joseph Smith’s first vision.

item.title: Episode 7—The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Examines how Joseph Smith obtained and translated the records that became the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Episode 8—Harmony, Pennsylvania
item.description: Discusses the significance of Harmony, Pennsylvania, and the events that took place there, including Joseph Smith’s marriage to Emma Hale and the birth and death of their first child.

item.title: Episode 9—Restoration of the Priesthoods
item.description: Examines the conferral of divine authority by heavenly beings upon Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery and the importance of those events to later developments.

item.title: Episode 10—The Joseph Smith Papers—Roundtable 1
item.description: Managing editor Ronald K. Esplin chairs a discussion with members of the Joseph Smith Papers Project’s staff about the significance of the project for Latter-day Saints and others.

item.title: Episode 11—The Joseph Smith Papers—Roundtable 2
item.description: Members of the Joseph Smith Papers Project staff describe the day-to-day work of producing the Papers from acquisition of documents to transcription to editorial policies.

item.title: Episode 12—The Book of Mormon Translation
item.description: Scholars present textual evidence that provides clues on the process of translating the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Episode 13—Book of Mormon Printing and Editions
item.description: Discusses the publication of the first edition of the Book of Mormon, including the printing process and local reaction to the book.

item.title: Episode 14—Lucy Mack Smith, Joseph Smith’s First Biographer
item.description: Discusses Lucy Mack Smith’s history, begun in 1844—one of the first and most valuable histories of Joseph Smith and the early history of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Episode 15—Joseph Smith and the History of the Church
item.description: Dean Jessee discusses the early instruction to the church that “there shall be a record kept” and Joseph Smith’s efforts to obey it.

item.title: Episode 16—The Journals of Joseph Smith
item.description: Examines the journals kept by Joseph Smith and his scribes as well as the insights they provide into the life and work of the man himself.

item.title: Episode 17—Oliver Cowdery, the Second Elder
item.description: Scholars discuss Oliver Cowdery’s role in church history and his relationship with Joseph Smith.

item.title: Episode 18—Contemporaries of Joseph Smith
item.description: Offers descriptions of Joseph Smith from his contemporaries and perspectives on his influence from several modern scholars.

item.title: Episode 19—Joseph Smith’s Leg Operation
item.description: Discusses the childhood illness and subsequent operation on seven-year-old Joseph Smith’s leg by Dr. Nathan Smith.

item.title: Episode 20—The Joseph Smith Translation (JST), Part 1
item.description: Robert J. Matthews discusses the Joseph Smith Translation of the Bible, its history, and its contributions.

item.title: Episode 21—The Joseph Smith Translation (JST), Part 2
item.description: Explores Joseph Smith’s commission to revise the Bible, the process of revision, and the history of the manuscript.

item.title: Episode 22—The Letters of Joseph and Emma Smith
item.description: Examines the surviving letters between Joseph and Emma Smith, which they wrote during their many absences from each other during their seventeen-year marriage.

item.title: Episode 23—The Revelations of Joseph Smith
item.description: Discusses the revelations of Joseph Smith and how they became part of the Doctrine and Covenants.

item.title: Episode 24—The Organization of the Church
item.description: Revisits the organization of the Church of Christ on April 6, 1830, in Fayette, New York.

item.title: Episode 25—Kirtland Beginnings
item.description: Focuses on Kirtland, Ohio, as the first designated gathering place for the Latter-day Saints and the town’s history, problems, and importance in Latter-day Saint history.

item.title: Episode 26—Kirtland and the Kirtland Temple, the House of the Lord
item.description: Recounts some of the hardships of the Kirtland period as well as the purpose and plans for the House of the Lord, or temple.

item.title: Episode 27—The Kirtland Temple: Endowment of Power and Solemn Assembly
item.description: Looks at the events that took place in the temple at Kirtland and how those events shaped the church.

item.title: Episode 28—The Building of Zion
item.description: Focuses on the concept of Zion in early Latter-day Saint belief, both as a theological ideal and as a physical place.

item.title: Episode 29—Zion’s Camp
item.description: Focuses on the expeditionary force, later known as Zion’s Camp, which Joseph Smith raised under revelatory mandate to restore displaced church members in Jackson County, Missouri, to their lands.

item.title: Episode 30—The Kirtland Crisis
item.description: Discusses how economic struggles and the failure of the Kirtland Safety Society helped precipitate a crisis in Kirtland.

item.title: Episode 31—Joseph Smith and the Law: Part 1, New York and Ohio
item.description: Discusses some of Joseph Smith’s encounters with the legal system in New York and Ohio.

item.title: Episode 32—The Mormons in Far West and Northern Missouri
item.description: Explores the experiences of the Mormons in Caldwell County, a place specifically designated by the state of Missouri for Mormon settlement.

item.title: Episode 33—The Mormon War
item.description: Examines the causes and events of what became known as the Mormon War and Governor Lilburn W. Boggs’s “extermination order.”

item.title: Episode 34—Liberty Jail
item.description: Looks at the events following the Mormon War and how Joseph Smith and his associates came to be incarcerated at Liberty jail, conditions in the jail, and how the experience changed Joseph Smith.

item.title: Episode 35—The Mormon Exodus from Missouri
item.description: Examines the exodus of Latter-day Saints from Missouri under the “extermination order” signed by Governor Lilburn W. Boggs and executed by the state militia.

item.title: Episode 36—The Mission of the Twelve to England
item.description: Discusses the mission of the Twelve Apostles to England, which not only swelled the ranks of the church with thousands of British converts but also refined the leadership of the quorum.

item.title: Episode 37—Joseph Smith and the Law: Part 2, Missouri
item.description: Examines the legal challenges Joseph Smith and the church faced in Missouri.

item.title: Episode 38—Nauvoo Beginnings
item.description: Explores church members’ settlement in Illinois, beginning in Quincy and eventually moving to Commerce, which was renamed Nauvoo.

item.title: Episode 39—Joseph Smith Goes to Washington
item.description: Focuses on Joseph Smith’s efforts in Washington DC to obtain redress for the church’s losses in Missouri.

item.title: Episode 40—The Sermons of Joseph Smith
item.description: Discusses the remaining accounts of Joseph Smith’s sermons, many of them given extemporaneously, contrary to the practice of other ministers of the day.

item.title: Episode 41—The Nauvoo Temple and Nauvoo House
item.description: Explores the purposes and construction of two of Nauvoo’s largest public projects, the temple and the Nauvoo House.

item.title: Episode 42—The Book of Abraham
item.description: Discusses the acquisition, translation, and publication of the text of papyri purchased from Michael Chandler which became the canonical Book of Abraham.

item.title: Episode 43—Developments in Nauvoo
item.description: Explores the evolution of church doctrines and liturgy in Nauvoo.

item.title: Episode 44—Foundations of the Women’s Relief Society
item.description: Discusses the history of the Relief Society and its evolution from a sewing society to provide clothing for men laboring on the temple to a multifaceted society founded on the principle of charity.

item.title: Episode 45—Joseph Smith and the Law, Part 3, Illinois and Extradition
item.description: Examines the legal battle over an attempt by Missouri officials to extradite Joseph Smith from Illinois despite the dismissal of the charge against him.

item.title: Episode 46—The Beginnings of International Mormonism
item.description: Looks at the first efforts to expand Mormonism’s reach beyond the borders of the United States and create an international church.

item.title: Episode 47—The Climax of Nauvoo, Part 1
item.description: Explores the mounting tension over Joseph Smith’s doctrinal innovations, especially the introduction of plural marriage.

item.title: Episode 48—The Climax of Nauvoo, Part 2
item.description: Discusses the last months of Joseph Smith’s life, including his campaign for the American presidency, final instructions on priesthood and church government, and last doctrinal innovations.

item.title: Episode 49—The Martyrdom of Joseph and Hyrum Smith
item.description: Examines the murders of Joseph Smith and his brother Hyrum and the events leading up to the murders, including the destruction of the Nauvoo Expositor.

item.title: Episode 50—The Martyrdom: Aftermath
item.description: Discusses the events that followed the death of Joseph Smith, including competing claims of leadership in the absence of the church’s prophet.

item.title: Episode 51—The Last Days of Nauvoo
item.description: Explores the question of who should take the church’s reins in the absence of its founder and the eventual exodus from Nauvoo.

item.title: The Unknown Treasure
item.description: Kate Holbrook tells the story of Jutta Baum Busche's discovery of the unknown treasure–the knowledge of who we really are.

item.title: Forbear and Forgive
item.description: Jennifer Reeder relates the story of Jane Neyman being rejected for membership in the Nauvoo Female Relief Society. Jane later taught "all to be forbearing and forgiving."

item.title: Our Father in Heaven Has a Mission for Us
item.description: When entire congregations in South Africa expressed interest in joining the church, language was a barrier. Judy Brummer's fluency in the Xhosa language paved the way for hundreds to be baptized.

item.title: A Revelation for Emma Smith
item.description: Jennifer Reeder discusses the revelation commanding Emma Hale Smith to "expound and exhort" and its application to early and modern Latter-day Saint women.

item.title: The Music of the Gospel
item.description: The joy of the dance will be experienced only when we come to hear the music.

item.title: World Report April 2016
item.description: The World Report is produced semi-annually by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: A Refugee Remembers – President Uchtdorf
item.description: President Uchtdorf recounts his childhood during WWII and the hardships of refugee life.

item.title: Elder Ballard’s Ministry To Refugees in Europe
item.description: Elder Ballard visits with refugees and children in Berlin and LDS volunteers who are working to help them adapt after being separated from their homelands.

item.title: Reaching Out to Women and Children in Asia
item.description: Sister Marriott and Sister Esplin minister to women and their children in the developing regions of Asia.

item.title: New Apostles Called To The Twelve
item.description: Elder Rasband, Elder Stevenson and Elder Renlund each share their testimonies on the day their respective call to The Twelve.

item.title: Provo City Center Temple
item.description: The history and recent development of the former Provo Tabernacle and it’s transformation into a temple

item.title: Elder Bednar Confirms Missionary Presence in Liberia
item.description: Elder Bednar meets with members and missionaries in Liberia and dispels concern about the public health of this region in Africa.

item.title: Missionary Update
item.description: Elder Nielsen discusses the numbers of Elders and Sisters serving world-wide from the time of the age of service eligibility announcement

item.title: Deseret Cattle & Citrus
item.description: The inner workings of a Church-owned ranch and it’s environmental balance

item.title: Temple Groundbreakings and Dedications
item.description: A fast-paced review of temple developments around the globe

item.title: Relief Society History Book
item.description: A new volume chronicles the early history of the Relief Society and profiles many of the women who gave so much of their lives to the early church

item.title: Church History Museum Reopens
item.description: New exhibits on display that tell the early history of The Church

item.title: RootsTech Conference
item.description: Thousands gather at this annual genealogical conference in Salt Lake City and hear guest presenter and author, Doris Kearns Goodwin

item.title: Service in Dubai
item.description: The interfaith work of Latter-day Saints to help their neighbors during their religious holiday

item.title: BYU Hawaii’s New President
item.description: President Tanner takes the reigns of leadership at this Island University

item.title: Ted Koppel Profiles LDS Preparedness
item.description: Renowned Journalist tours Church welfare facilities

item.title: Christmas Concert With Laura Osnes
item.description: Returning Broadway Star sings with the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and shares her first impressions
